label: Hubris
description: An overconfidence in one’s specialness that rejects counsel and underestimates risk. It weaponizes admirable strengths (courage, brilliance) into grandstanding, and it bends motivations like mastery or justice toward spectacle. Under pressure, hubris steers arcs toward downfall or pyrrhic victory and invites reputational blowback when secrets or mistakes surface.

label: Obsession
description: A fixation that crowds out perspective, sleep, and relationships. Obsession can supercharge motivations (revenge, discovery, mastery) but narrows empathy and blinds to collateral damage. The arc hinges on whether the character learns to subordinate the focus to a larger good or burns everything for it.

label: Addiction
description: Dependence on a substance or behavior that erodes reliability and trust. It spawns secrets, blackmail risk, and cycles of relapse that destabilize teams. Redemption arcs demand visible accountability; tragic arcs show how craving eclipses purpose.

label: Cowardice
description: A pattern of avoiding risk or responsibility at others’ expense. It clashes with protector or justice motivations and creates harsh internal dissonance between self‑image and behavior. Courage becomes meaningful only once fear is acknowledged and acted through, not denied.

label: Perfectionism
description: Standards so unforgiving that nothing ever ships. It masquerades as diligence while stifling collaboration and momentum, particularly in precision roles (engineer, judge, surgeon). The cure is learning that done, shared, and iterated beats immaculate but imaginary.

label: Paranoia
description: Hypervigilance that reads threats into every shadow. Useful in espionage, it corrodes coalitions, making betrayal self‑fulfilling. The flaw resolves only when the character risks calibrated trust and tolerates uncertainty without control.

label: Fanaticism
description: Zeal so rigid it justifies cruelty and refuses nuance. It hijacks noble motivations (faith, justice) and makes compromise impossible, pushing outcomes toward atrocity, martyrdom, or schism. Allies become heretics the moment they hesitate.

label: Nihilism
description: The conviction that nothing matters, dissolving purpose and obligation. It breeds reckless risk or apathetic drift, sabotaging causes that need belief. The only escape is a chosen meaning—the decision to care despite cosmic indifference.

label: Jealousy
description: Fear of losing love or status that provokes control, sabotage, and surveillance. It thrives in secrecy and scandal, corroding reputations and alliances. Only security earned through honesty—not possession—defuses it.

label: Vengefulness
description: A compulsion to retaliate even when it harms one’s cause. It rots justice into vendetta and invites escalation traps set by canny antagonists. Resolution demands substituting reparation and prevention for pain‑for‑pain.

label: Control Fixation
description: Micromanaging people and variables to fend off anxiety. Effective in crisis, it suffocates teams and successors in peacetime. Sustainable leadership requires letting others own outcomes and tolerating imperfect paths.

label: Compulsive Dishonesty
description: Lying as default, until trust detonates irrevocably. It’s an asset in undercover work, poison everywhere else. The reckoning is necessarily public; rebuilding requires truth told at personal cost.

label: Prideful Honor
description: A rigid code obeyed even when mercy would save lives. It is noble but brittle, pitting oath against compassion and turning the rulebook into the true antagonist. Growth reframes honor as protection of people, not procedures.

label: Ruthlessness
description: Results‑only pragmatism that discards ethics and relationships. It wins battles while losing the war for the soul and the coalition; allies become assets, then casualties. The bill arrives as revolt, despair, or self‑recognition.

label: Impatience
description: A refusal to wait that breaks plans and people. Urgency becomes recklessness; opportunities turn into crises. The lesson is cadence: fast where speed matters, slow where alignment prevents future fires.

label: Martyr Complex
description: Compulsive self‑sacrifice that denies delegation, consent, and rest. It garners adoration but breeds dependency and burnout. True service includes longevity and teaching others to stand.

label: Savior Complex
description: The need to fix everyone, even unasked, turning care into control. It erases agency in the name of love and collapses when a rescue fails. Healthy help requires boundaries and respect for refusal.

label: Rigidity
description: Inability to adapt when facts or contexts change. It breaks in fluid environments and alienates flexible allies. Maturity appears when principles are kept but tactics bend.

label: Compulsive Secrecy
description: Withholding information even from allies as a reflex. It multiplies paranoia, invites catastrophic unmasking, and enables the very betrayals it feared. Trustworthy governance requires sunlight by default, shadow by exception.

label: Escapism
description: Habitual flight into fantasy, vice, or busyness to avoid pain. It buys short‑term relief while letting problems metastasize. The pivot is facing the wound, not outrunning it.

label: Workaholism
description: Overuse of labor to dodge intimacy or grief. It wins reputation and revenue while hollowing health and home. Recovery means scheduling humanity, not just output.

label: Vanity
description: Image over substance, inviting manipulation and scandal. It starves truth‑seeking motivations and hollows victory into spectacle. Humility—crediting others, welcoming critique—restores ballast.

label: Possessiveness
description: Treating people as property in love or leadership. Loyalty becomes captivity; safety becomes surveillance. Release—trust freely given and revocable—proves love and earns allegiance.

label: Cynicism
description: Chronic bad‑faith interpretation that preempts hope. It may protect from disappointment, but it kills coalition—the engine of any durable win. Courage is choosing optimism with eyes open.

label: Greed
description: Overvaluing acquisition at ethical cost. It corrodes reputations and partnerships, making betrayal a business model. The arc turns when value broadens from owning to building.

label: Fatalism
description: Surrender to “fate” that abdicates responsibility. It ensures missed chances for change and makes doom self‑fulfilling. Agency begins the moment the character acts anyway.

label: Self‑Loathing
description: Internal contempt that repels help and sabotages success. It rewrites feedback as proof of worthlessness, not care. Healing requires being seen and accepted, then practicing competence.

label: Denial
description: Refusal to face hard truths (illness, betrayal, limits). It delays action until options narrow to tragedy. The turn is naming reality aloud to allies who can help.

label: Imprudence
description: Taking outsized risks without preparation. It flatters bravery while creating preventable disasters. Tempered risk—scoped, staged, insured—keeps valor from becoming vanity.

label: Manipulativeness
description: Treating relationships as levers rather than bonds. It pays in short‑term wins and long‑term loneliness. Trust, once spent this way, is expensive to rebuy.

label: Short‑Sightedness
description: Optimizing today while mortgaging tomorrow. It yields pyrrhic victories and strategic regret. The antidote is a horizon—legacy questions that shape choices.

label: Envy
description: Resenting others’ success and turning collaboration into rivalry. It drains energy from building to tallying. Gratitude and distinctive goals blunt the poison.

label: Apathy
description: Emotional disengagement that starves causes and people. It makes the character dead weight until shock or love reignites purpose. Commitment must be chosen, not drifted into.

label: Intransigence
description: Refusal to negotiate even when interests align. It kills diplomatic paths and forces costly collisions. Strength is measured by outcomes, not obstinacy.

label: Cruelty
description: Willingness to inflict pain for control or pleasure. It cements villainy and forecloses redemption. Empathy training is too late; only accountability constrains it.

label: Shame
description: A belief in unworthiness that hides behind masks. It fuels secrets and isolation until witnessed and accepted. Self‑respect grows from kept promises, not perfection.

label: Jeer‑Driven Humor
description: Barbed wit that keeps others at arm’s length. It wins laughs while hollowing trust. Vulnerability, not punchlines, builds intimacy.

label: Oath‑Bound Inflexibility
description: Sacred promises obeyed despite changing contexts. Noble in intent, it pits loyalty against wisdom and often ends in sacrifice. Re‑oathing with nuance is the path forward.

label: Forbidden‑Knowledge Hunger
description: Pursuit of truths that corrupt or endanger. It suits magicians and scholars and scales stakes to civilizations. Guardrails—purpose, peers, and pauses—keep curiosity from becoming catastrophe.

label: Complacency
description: Comfort with the status quo that ignores rot. It resists necessary change until collapse forces it violently. Wakefulness restores stewardship before crisis.

label: Indecision
description: Chronic hesitation that misses windows of opportunity. It drains confidence in leaders and lovers alike. Clarity of values makes decisive action possible.

label: Procrastination
description: Delaying the hard work until crisis compresses choices. It forces shortcuts, invites error, and harms reputation for reliability. Systems beat willpower; build them.

label: Hedonism
description: Pursuit of pleasure at the cost of duty. It jeopardizes protector or justice motivations and invites scandal. Integration—making space for joy without betrayal—matures desire.

label: People‑Pleasing
description: Chasing approval over principle. It compromises strategy and self‑respect, and makes the character easy to capture socially. Saying no is a form of self‑definition.

label: Conflict Avoidance
description: Fear of confrontation that lets problems metastasize. It sacrifices long‑term health for short‑term comfort. The first hard talk is the cheapest.

label: Overtrusting
description: Granting confidence without verification. It invites infiltration and exploitation, especially against cunning antagonists. Trust is not a feeling; it’s a policy.

label: Tunnel Vision
description: Fixation on one objective that misses flanking threats. It pairs poorly with strategist allies and ends in ambush. Widen the frame; add scouts.

label: Magical Thinking
description: Preferring superstition or signs over evidence. It distorts decisions and empowers charlatans. Test, measure, and falsify—then believe.

label: Unexamined Traditionalism
description: Clinging to inherited ways regardless of harm. It blocks reform arcs and marginalizes the vulnerable. Honor the roots by pruning the rot.

label: Risk Aversion
description: Avoiding uncertainty so completely that opportunity never arrives. Security becomes a cage; the safest option is decay. Small, repeated bets rebuild courage.

label: Grandiosity
description: Inflated belief in destiny or genius that demands exceptions. It treats others as extras in one’s story and brooks no limits. Humility is reality’s invitation to partnership.

label: Over‑Sanctimony
description: Flaunting moral superiority to police others. It alienates allies and dares fate to expose hypocrisy. Quiet integrity persuades; posing repels.

label: Emotional Withholding
description: Refusing to share feelings or needs. It starves intimacy and forces mind‑reading that always fails. Naming the need repairs the bond.

label: Suspicion
description: Defaulting to ulterior‑motive assumptions. Prudence without warmth freezes coalitions. Assume goodwill until contradicted—then respond proportionally.

label: Masochism
description: Seeking or tolerating suffering as proof of worth. It invites exploitation and confuses loyalty with self‑harm. Healthy love includes limits.

label: Opportunism
description: Switching loyalties for advantage. It wins short‑term position and loses long‑term trust. Choose a hill and stand on it.

label: Impulsiveness
description: Acting on feeling before thought. Sometimes brilliant, usually costly; the bill is paid in preventable harm. Insert pause rituals before plunges.

label: Guilt‑Fixation
description: Compulsively self‑punishing for past harm. It blocks forward motion and rejects forgiveness offered. Making amends is action, not self‑erasure.

label: Isolationism
description: Withdrawing from community to avoid vulnerability. It preserves safety while starving growth and insight. The right few allies beat perfect solitude.

label: Fickleness
description: Rapid shifts in taste, allegiance, or mood. It creates chaos and makes promises meaningless. Consistency—kept small commitments—redeems volatility.

label: Arrogant
description: Inflates self-worth and discounts others, provoking external resistance and blinding strategy; pairs disastrously with leadership roles and has a straight line to hubristic destiny.

label: Cowardly
description: Avoids danger at any cost, undermining trust and forcing others to carry risk; creates acute internal conflict when motivation demands courage (e.g., to protect a loved one).

label: Reckless
description: Acts without weighing consequences, producing pyrrhic wins; clashes with meticulous teammates and escalates external conflict unnecessarily.

label: Manipulative
description: Engineers outcomes by exploiting people; invaluable to spies and merchants yet corrodes reputation and relationships; secrets are both tools and liabilities.

label: Vindictive
description: Pursues payback at the expense of all else, warping motivation and endangering allies; destiny trends toward tragedy unless checked by forgiveness.

label: Jealous
description: Fears loss of affection or status, breeding sabotage and deceit; often triggered by secrets and inflamed by reputation shifts.

label: Deceitful
description: Habitually lies, fracturing trust; useful in covert occupations but lethal to leadership cohesion when revealed.

label: Greedy
description: Overvalues acquisition, compromising ethics and alliances; external conflicts over resources intensify; internal emptiness persists.

label: Dogmatic
description: Clings to doctrine despite evidence, creating brittle decision-making; collides with open‑minded teammates and adaptive strategy.

label: Intemperate
description: Lacks moderation (anger, lust, spending), inviting scandal and blackmail; plays directly into antagonist traps.

label: Impulsive
description: Jumps to action on emotion, bypassing planning; occasionally yields brilliance but more often magnifies stakes unnecessarily.

label: Pessimistic
description: Expects the worst, sapping morale and missing opportunities; can be protective in high‑risk contexts but often self‑fulfilling.

label: Perfectionist
description: Sets unattainable standards that stall progress and erode teams; pairs toxicly with creator/engineer archetypes without humility.

label: Callous
description: Numbs empathy, enabling cruelty or neglect; effective in brutal settings, but reputationally radioactive.

label: Hypocritical
description: Preaches values they won’t practice, detonating credibility when secrets inevitable surface; devastating for priests, judges, and leaders.

label: Envious
description: Covets others’ success, turning collaboration into rivalry; may drive growth but often curdles into sabotage.

label: Naïve
description: Misreads danger and manipulation, risking self and group; a transitional flaw for innocents on coming‑of‑age arcs.

label: Apathetic
description: Lacks concern or motivation, stalling plots until external pressure forces movement; corrosive to group dynamics.

label: Cynical
description: Assumes bad faith, poisoning trust; may sharpen analysis but often prevents alliance-building crucial to victory.

label: Stubborn
description: Refuses to shift stance despite new data; steady under fire but brittle when wrong, endangering outcomes.

label: Overbearing
description: Dominates and micromanages, suffocating initiative; especially harmful in leadership roles.

label: Paranoid
description: Sees threats everywhere, creating self-fulfilling betrayals; secrets and espionage arcs intensify this flaw.

label: Vain
description: Seeks admiration over substance, misallocating effort and exposing to manipulation; reputation obsession trumps real stakes.

label: Indecisive
description: Delays commitments, missing windows of opportunity; breeds frustration in urgent external conflicts.

label: Ruthless
description: Discards ethics to achieve goals; effective against monsters and tyrants, but the cost to soul and team is severe.

label: Gullible
description: Over‑trusts appearances, becoming a gateway for antagonist plots; pairs poorly with detective roles.

label: Spiteful
description: Harms others even at own cost; escalates interpersonal wars that distract from main conflicts.

label: Obsessive
description: Fixates on one aim, corroding health and relationships; can deliver breakthroughs at catastrophic personal price.

label: Miserly
description: Hoarding erodes goodwill and resilience; backfires in crises requiring mutual aid.

label: Bigoted
description: Devalues groups based on identity, destroying alliances and legitimacy; external conflict often exposes and punishes this flaw.

label: Fanatical
description: Pursues belief with absolute zeal, immune to compromise; powerful in movements but prone to atrocity.

label: Lazy
description: Avoids exertion, shifting burdens to others; in high‑stakes arcs, becomes untenable and forces reckonings.

label: Masochistic
description: Seeks or tolerates suffering, confusing loyalty with self‑harm; invites exploitation by antagonists.

label: Martinet
description: Enforces rules without judgment, crushing morale; brittle in fluid battlefields and diplomacy.

label: Petty
description: Fixates on small slights, derailing strategy over trivialities; reputationally corrosive.

label: Resentful
description: Nurtures grudges that warp teamwork; easily weaponized by a savvy antagonist.

label: Secretive
description: Withholds information reflexively, even when trust would serve; amplifies paranoia and fractures teams.

label: Short‑tempered
description: Flashes to anger, escalating minor sparks into conflagrations; exploitable via provocation.

label: Superstitious
description: Misattributes causes and seeks magical fixes, sabotaging rational plans; manipulable by charlatans.

label: Two‑faced
description: Acts differently for different audiences, beyond healthy code‑switching; when exposed, destroys reputation capital.

label: Wasteful
description: Burns resources imprudently, weakening long‑term position; often paired with impulsiveness or vanity.

label: Withdrawn
description: Retreats from engagement, starving teams of input and bonding; sometimes a trauma shield that must be healed.

label: Workaholic
description: Overworks to avoid feelings, eroding judgment and relationships; appears virtuous until collapse.

label: Anxious
description: Anticipates catastrophe, impairing performance; can sharpen preparation but requires support.

label: Cruel
description: Inflicts pain for control or amusement; cements villain status and forecloses redemptive destinies.

label: Delusional
description: Clings to false beliefs, making them dangerous and unpredictable; secrets and reputations become unstable.

label: Dishonorable
description: Breaks oaths lightly, destroying legitimacy; in oath‑bound cultures, this is a social death.

label: Egotistical
description: Centers self in all narratives; impossible collaborator unless humbled by events.

label: Fickle
description: Changes allegiance or taste rapidly, creating chaos; difficult to rely upon in critical arcs.

label: Gloomy
description: Radiates despair that demoralizes allies; in horror, may be accurate but still harmful to cohesion.

label: Hard‑hearted
description: Rejects appeals to mercy, making negotiations brittle; simplifies decisions at the cost of humanity.

label: Hot‑headed
description: Rushes into fights, predictable and provokable; useful for enemies.

label: Hypercritical
description: Nitpicks and demeans, stifling creativity; undermines creators and innovators.

label: Ignorant
description: Lacks essential knowledge and resists learning; survivable if humble, deadly if proud.

label: Impish
description: Mischief without wisdom, burning bridges for laughs; fun in low stakes, fatal in high stakes.

label: Inflexible
description: Cannot adapt, breaking under novelty; defeats strategists’ plans from the inside.

label: Insensitive
description: Misses emotional cues, harming relationships; fixable with awareness and empathy training.

label: Intolerant
description: Cannot abide difference; collapses diverse coalitions and invites righteous opposition.

label: Irresponsible
description: Evades accountability, breeding chaos; antagonists capitalize on the blame vacuum.

label: Melodramatic
description: Inflates events for attention, distracting from substance; reputationally undermining.

label: Negligent
description: Fails duties through inattention; devastating in guardian/healer roles.

label: Prideful
description: Rejects help and feedback; classical path to downfall absent humility.

label: Reclusive
description: Hides from community, starving self of support; sometimes necessary in fugitive arcs, often isolating.

label: Sanctimonious
description: Flaunts moral superiority; alienates allies and invites tests that expose hypocrisy.

label: Self‑pitying
description: Fixates on own suffering; drains teams and stalls growth until reframed.

label: Scheming
description: Plots constantly, treating people as pieces; brilliant in chessboard politics, ruinous in trust‑based teams.

label: Suspicious
description: Assumes ulterior motives, blocking coalition; can be prudent in espionage, corrosive elsewhere.

label: Thuggish
description: Uses intimidation by default; effective short‑term, strategic dead‑end long‑term.

label: Waste‑averse
description: Hoarding to a fault, missing opportunities that require investment; opposite of wasteful yet equally limiting.
